Main Content:
The Build Fellowship: H-1B Programs for Foreign Nationals A cap‑exempt H‑1B solution trusted by companies nationwide The Build Fellowship is a nationally recognized cap‑exempt H‑1B visa fellowship with a 99% approval rate. The program offers work visa pathways for global talent building careers and companies in the U.S. Get started Join our next info session Why Build? An immigration pathway to train the future U.S. workforce A reliable immigration solution The Build Fellowship offers a cap-exempt H-1B visa solution with a 99% acceptance rate, allowing foreign nationals to pursue careers in the U.S. Fills talent gaps for U.S. companies Attract the world’s top talent for full-time U.S. employment opportunities through partnering with The Build Fellowship. Advances missions of U.S. colleges The Build Fellowship partners with education institutions to build students’ industry skills through experiential learning projects. Get Started Learn More 0 + Foreign national participants 0 + Student participants 0 % Visa approval rate For global talent A cap-exempt H-1B program to help global talent build careers in the U.S. Find an H-1B visa solution If you are a foreign national who wants to work or continue working in the U.S., securing your visa is a top priority — The Build Fellowship is here to help. Get started Learn more Work with driven students from partners schools Build Fellows work part-time remotely leading students from partner colleges and universities in experiential, project-based learning while being sponsored for their cap-exempt H-1Bs. Get started Learn more Browse our immigration resources Explore resources, frequently asked questions, and webinars to ensure you understand all that The Build Fellowship has to offer. Get started For Companies Access specialized talent and maintain your competitive edge Attract the world’s top talent Attract the world’s top foreign nationals for full-time U.S. employment opportunities and retain existing talent by offering alternative visa solutions. Gain unique access to students entering the workforce who are trained with relevant industry knowledge. Get started Learn more A back-up plan to the H-1B lottery Achieve peace of mind knowing you have a back-up plan to the H-1B lottery, so you can forecast and plan your staff needs accordingly. Receive ongoing access to immigration support and guidance for your employees. Get started Learn more For students Dynamic and immersive 8-week projects led by Build Fellows Industry-focused learning Build Fellows lead students in real-world experiential learning projects and career development programming that will help them better understand their field of interest and bridge the gap between the classroom and industry. Get Started Learn more Resume building, entry-level projects Students produce deliverables they can showcase on their resumes and portfolios. Projects are designed to be accessible for students at any level of their professional career. Get Started Learn more Discover the Education Hub Join resume-building projects and gain hands-on experience with Build Fellows from the fast-growing industries. Testimonials A trusted immigration solution for talent and companies Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Lauren Abda Founder, Branchfood The Build Fellowship changed my life for the better! Not only did it do so in the most obvious way (set up an immigration pathway in the U.S.) but it also helped me discover my own leadership and management skills. ‍ Ketaki Adhikari Principal Research Associate, Foghorn Therapeutics The Build Fellowship has brought top talent from growing companies to inspire and educate our students. They have been instrumental in helping diverse learners build social capital and technical skills to land fulfilling roles at high-growth companies. ‍ Aisha Francis President, Franklin Tech The Build Fellowship has put together a superb program. We were able to get our employee from overseas and shepherd his H-1B capped process. Highly recommend as the complete end-to-end solution for your H-1B needs. ‍ Mason Zheng Founder, Telgorithm Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Jad Esber Founder, Koodos Labs The Build Fellowship has given us peace of mind. This opportunity allows us to retain our top talent and gives our employees a chance to practice their leadership and project management skills. Kendra Heard HR, Outrider.ai We're grateful to have learned about The Build Fellowship, which has been key to hiring and retaining talent in scientific expertise sets. Build is an invaluable resource in the face of an otherwise frustrating and opaque process. Robert DiFazio CEO, Parallel Bio Every year the H-1B cap lottery gets worse and the odds are stacked against employers and their candidates who require an H-1B work visa. I am very glad to have found out about Open Avenues [Build Fellowship] and its unique model to facilitate concurrent H-1B opportunities— it is definitely worth checking out. Bob Webber Webber Arredondo Oja, LLC The Open Avenues Foundation has proven to be an invaluable partner for my practice. The Build Fellowship has ensured that my clients are able to retain key foreign talent while participants can continue to develop their practical skills in the United States. This is an essential solution to problems posed by an unpredictable immigration landscape. Alex Peters Peters Immigration Law P.C. Our clients appreciate working with Open Avenues! The program provides an alternative path for individuals to live and work in the U.S. when their employment here is urgent and important and if they aren't qualified for an O-1 yet or can't afford to wait for the H-1B lottery. It's wonderful being able to offer our clients an alternate path. Not only are our clients' lives and companies changed, but it's amazing to pay it forward and improve the quality of U.S. STEM education for our students! Sophie Alcorn Alcorn Immigration Law Shritesh is a foreign national from Nepal, and came to the United States in 2015 to pursue his masters. He had a penchant for two things: entrepreneurship and mentorship—two pursuits he wanted to continue in the United States, a place he saw limitless in opportunities. After getting selected for The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues, Shritesh created an industry-based project through his company, Remix Labs where he was assigned a Queens College student named Wilber. An aspiring software engineer with a passion for coding and gaming, Wilber brought a fresh, technical perspective to the no-code software platform Remix Labs operates on. His dedication, above-and-beyond approach and work ethic did not go unnoticed. Shritesh was so impressed by his work, that Wilber became the first junior-level, no-interview hire. Mentoring Wilber and witnessing his growth reinforced the gratifying experience of guiding future tech talents.
“The internship at Remix Labs was great for someone like me who wanted to get into programming in the tech space. During the internship, I got exposure to the Remix Labs platform and all of its functionalities. The platform itself is a no-code tool used to build out applications. I also learned how to design the flow of an app process data in a programming environment. Shritesh was such a smart and approachable project leader, and helped me every step of the way. He was my biggest advocate and got me a job as a Product Engineer position at the company—with no interview! He believed in me that much! Though I’m not working on his team, I still consider him my mentor. He’s the reason I was able to start my career.”
Shritesh Bhattarai Open Avenues Fellow, Software Engineer at Remix Labs Previous slide Next slide Resources Immigration resources and fellowship information Events and webinars Keep up with The Build Fellowship's updates and activities. Page Title: About Us – The Build Fellowship
Meta Description: Learn about The Build Fellowship's mission to provide the world's best talent with opportunities to build the future of the United States through cap-exempt H-1B visas.
H1: Building pathways for global talent
All Headings:
H1: Building pathways for global talent
H2: The Build Fellowship story
H2: The Build philosophy
H3: Talent transcends boundaries
H3: Global talent strengthens the U.S.
H3: Creativity is a solution
H2: In 2024, The Build Fellowship’s education programming is projected to serve over 500 individuals at 10 partner institutions with programming put on by 100 Fellows.
H3: We’re always looking for new talent
Main Content: About Us – The Build Fellowship Building pathways for global talent We believe when global talent builds in the United States, we all progress. Partner with us About The Build Fellowship story In 2014, The Build Fellowship’s Cofounder and Chief Immigration Officer, Jeff Goldman developed the legal infrastructure for what became the country’s first cap-exempt H-1B program, the Global Entrepreneur in Residence (GEIR) program. Jeff worked alongside USCIS and former Massachusetts Governor Deval Patrick to design a program that helped foreign national founders stay and build companies in Massachusetts, by working part-time for UMass Boston. Building on the success of that model, Jeff and Danielle - a father-daughter duo - came together in 2018 to solve the challenges of the adoption and implementation of the GEIR concept. Open Avenues Foundation became the first nonprofit affiliated with U.S. colleges and universities to offer part-time employment and cap-exempt H-1B sponsorship opportunities to foreign nationals willing to spend 5-hours per week leading students in skills-development programs. Over the last 5 years, Open Avenues Foundation has employed foreign founders and key talent from more than 150 companies within its Fellowship program, supporting 1000+ students from 12 colleges and universities around the United States. Now, The Build Fellowship is bringing this model to nonprofit partners across the country. $ 0 M contributed to the U.S. GDP by Build Fellows 0 % visa approval rate 0 + Student participants Values The Build philosophy Talent transcends boundaries Every person possesses the ability to achieve success, irrespective of their origin, background, or socio-economic status. Global talent strengthens the U.S. Foreign nationals are part and parcel to the United States’ rich social fabric, and robust economy. Varied cultural perspectives and incredible work ethic foster new ideas, which bloom into American businesses, creating more employment opportunities in the U.S. Creativity is a solution Creative thinking is the driver of effective and viable solutions. Build addresses entrenched challenges like immigration limitations, visa complications and talent scarcities through creativity and innovation. Impact In 2024, The Build Fellowship’s education programming is projected to serve over 500 individuals at 10 partner institutions with programming put on by 100 Fellows. Through The Build Fellowship, foreign nationals, in conjunction with nonprofit organizations, produce best-in-class research, publish industry content, lead 1-on-1 technical skills-building sessions, and offer industry guidance to college students and the public at-large in high-growth fields such as computer science, engineering, and biotechnology. In 2024, The Build Fellowship’s education programming is projected to serve over 500 individuals at 10 partner institutions with programming put on by 100 Fellows. This reflects a 600% growth in individuals served since 2020 along with more than a 300% increase in the number of partner institutions. How It Works An overview of The Build Fellowship Build Fellows Global talent applies for The Build Fellowship to access an immigration solution and train the future U.S. workforce. Companies Nominate global talent for The Build Fellowship to hire and retain employees, and also access a pipeline of candidates. Nonprofits Launch Build Fellowship programs to offer part-time, cap-exempt H-1B positions for global talent to work with university partners. Universities Partner with nonprofits to offer students access and work experiences with Build Fellows from high-growth companies. Requirements Admission requirements Qualifications Responsibilities Commitment A Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in a specialized field Exhibit a commitment to dedicate 5-8 hours weekly to support workforce development and education initiatives Demonstrated expertise within a specialized field Candidates must have a benefactor (a company, organization, or individual) willing to support the Fellowship costs – Fellows cannot fund their own Fellowship. Get started timeline Fellowship timeline 1 Evaluation & Contracting 2 – 3 weeks Nomination and application Candidate screening and H-1B evaluation Contract signed 2 Visa processing 6 - 8 Weeks Petition document development Cap-exempt H-1B visa approved (if no RFE) 3 Fellowship begins 1 Week Employment starts Full-time employer files concurrent visa petition For individuals outside of the U.S., their Fellowship begins when they enter the United States with a visa stamp 0 + Foreign national participants 0 States with fellowships 0 Countries represented 0 % Visa approval rate Resources Frequently asked questions Who is the H-1B petitioner? Benefits A cap-exempt H-1B visa solution with a 99% acceptance rate Visa Sponsorship & Support The Build Fellowship offers ongoing immigration support and guidance to Build Fellows, while sponsoring them for their part-time cap-exempt H-1B visas. This enables benefactors to file a full-time cap-exempt H-1B visa concurrently. Get started Part-Time, Remote Employment Fellows work 5+ hours per week launching projects and educational programming at partner universities to develop students’ skills and knowledge and prepare them for the future workforce. 1:1 lecture and mentorship sessions Experiential learning projects in your specialized field Hours are flexible and based on Fellow schedules Get started Requirements Admission requirements Qualifications Responsibilities Commitment A Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in a specialized field Exhibit a commitment to dedicate 5-8 hours weekly to support workforce development and education initiatives Demonstrated expertise within a specialized field Candidates must have a benefactor (a company, organization, or individual) willing to support the Fellowship costs – Fellows cannot fund their own Fellowship. Main Content: The Build Fellowship Hub Explore & Apply to Build Projects Embark on virtual, dynamic and immersive 8-week Build Projects. Engage in 1-hour weekly group workshops, receive mentorship and guidance from our talented Build Fellows to develop a deliverable worth adding to your portfolio. By the end of the project, you'll get a digital certificate. H3: Resume building

H3: Discover the Education Hub
H2: Student feedback
Main Content: The Build Fellowship: Students For Students Global mentorship in the fastest growing industries Build Fellows lead students at our partner colleges and universities in real-world experiential learning projects and career development programming. Get started Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Benefits Dynamic and immersive experiences Dynamic and immersive 8-week projects led by Build Fellows that aim to introduce selected students to their fields of interest. Selected participants engage in weekly live sessions with a Build Fellow and approximately 2–15 students. Students receive a certificate upon completion. Industry focused The projects center around specific industries, providing participants with hands-on, real-world challenges that will help them better understand their field of interest and bridge the gap between the classroom and industry. Resume building Students produce deliverables they can showcase on their resumes and portfolios to impress hiring managers filling entry-level positions. Entry-level Projects are designed to be accessible for students at any level of their professional career. We encourage first and second year students to participate. Discover the Education Hub Join resume-building projects and gain hands-on experience with Build Fellows from the fast-growing industries. Get started + 0 Students participating 0 % of students are confident they will succeed in the STEM / Business industry 0 + FOREIGN NATIONALS PARTICIPATING Testimonials Student feedback Through this opportunity, I was able to picture myself as a data analyst. This was my first time using Tableau. Now, it has become one of the skills I can offer to the companies I will be applying for. By doing this project, I have a solid presentation that I can add to my portfolio. I have a full-time job. I am not a traditional STEM student, and my background is in social sciences. I find that many internship opportunities are geared towards traditional, younger students. I am so grateful that Open Avenues [Build Fellowship] has given me a chance to build technical experience despite my unconventional career trajectory. The project leader was super nice. Despite his busy schedule, he made time to give me feedback on my project and even offered to do a resume review. He also taught us to how to use parameters and calculated fields inside Tableau, which came in very handy in my presentation. His feedback to add the article findings to my presentation made my claim stronger. Finding stories and pattern from data was very interesting and I even thought that I may be very good at it. Read more Jasmine Kim Queens College Cuny, Stony Brook University My experience was an extremely rewarding experience. The Build Fellow helped me develop technical skills. The project introduced me to new concepts and forms of analyses I had never done before. We utilized the time to answer questions and meet project goals. I'm thankful for this experience, it was a really good time exploring a career path I hadn't thought of before. Page Title: Sophie Alcorn – The Build Fellowship
Meta Description: Our clients appreciate working with Open Avenues! The program provides an alternative path for individuals to live and work in the U.S. when their employment...
All Headings: H3: Sophie Alcorn
Main Content: Sophie Alcorn – The Build Fellowship All Customer stories Sophie Alcorn Alcorn Immigration Law Our clients appreciate working with Open Avenues! The program provides an alternative path for individuals to live and work in the U.S. when their employment here is urgent and important and if they aren't qualified for an O-1 yet or can't afford to wait for the H-1B lottery. It's wonderful being able to offer our clients an alternate path. Not only are our clients' lives and companies changed, but it's amazing to pay it forward and improve the quality of U.S. STEM education for our students!

Page Title: Shritesh Bhattarai – The Build Fellowship
Meta Description: Shritesh is a foreign national from Nepal, and came to the United States in 2015 to pursue his masters. He had a penchant for two things: entrepreneurship an...
All Headings:
H3: Shritesh Bhattarai
H2: Wilber Queens College Graduate Product Engineer at Remix Lab
Main Content: Shritesh Bhattarai – The Build Fellowship All Customer stories Shritesh Bhattarai Open Avenues Fellow, Software Engineer at Remix Labs Shritesh is a foreign national from Nepal, and came to the United States in 2015 to pursue his masters. He had a penchant for two things: entrepreneurship and mentorship—two pursuits he wanted to continue in the United States, a place he saw limitless in opportunities. After getting selected for The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues, Shritesh created an industry-based project through his company, Remix Labs where he was assigned a Queens College student named Wilber. An aspiring software engineer with a passion for coding and gaming, Wilber brought a fresh, technical perspective to the no-code software platform Remix Labs operates on. His dedication, above-and-beyond approach and work ethic did not go unnoticed. Shritesh was so impressed by his work, that Wilber became the first junior-level, no-interview hire. Mentoring Wilber and witnessing his growth reinforced the gratifying experience of guiding future tech talents. “The internship at Remix Labs was great for someone like me who wanted to get into programming in the tech space. During the internship, I got exposure to the Remix Labs platform and all of its functionalities. The platform itself is a no-code tool used to build out applications. I also learned how to design the flow of an app process data in a programming environment. Shritesh was such a smart and approachable project leader, and helped me every step of the way. He was my biggest advocate and got me a job as a Product Engineer position at the company—with no interview! He believed in me that much! Though I’m not working on his team, I still consider him my mentor. He’s the reason I was able to start my career.” Wilber Queens College Graduate Product Engineer at Remix Lab

Main Content: The Build Fellowship: Nonprofit Partners Nonprofits Bring The Build Fellowship to your nonprofit The Build Fellowship helps nonprofits advance their mission-driven programs and enrich the U.S. economy with world-class global talent. Partner with us Overview Nonprofit partners create a pathway for Build Fellows to grow careers in the U.S. Four types of organizations in the U.S. can always employ foreign nationals, sponsoring them for H-1B visas. Among them are nonprofit organizations affiliated with higher education institutions. 0 + Foreign national participants 0 Student participants 0 % Visa approval rate How it works The Fellow and nonprofit relationship 1 Application The Build Fellowship welcomes applications from foreign national innovators, experts, and entrepreneurs seeking an immigration solution. 2 Placement The Build Fellowship works with nonprofits to place top candidates in part-time Fellowship positions and sponsor them for cap-exempt H-1B visas. 3 Employment Build Fellows work part-time at nonprofit partner organizations, allowing them to work for U.S. companies full-time on a cap-exempt H-1B visa. Become a Build partner today Interested in learning more about The Build Fellowship and how it can help your organization? Get in touch to explore visa solutions. Main Content: The Build Fellowship: Universities Universities Expert programming for exceptional education Becoming a Build Fellowship university partner means your students have access to experiential learning, with 1:1 domain-specific training by foreign national experts working in the fastest growing industries. Partner with us Benefits Bringing The Build Fellowship to your campus Career services for ambitious students The Build Fellowship offers students access to global expertise, providing world-class subject matter training and hands-on Build Projects. These experiences offer real industry exposure, a global perspective, and mentorship opportunities for ambitious students. Partner with us Immigration solutions for international students Partnering with international student departments, The Build Fellowship serves as an immigration solution for students finishing Optional Practical Training (OPT) or alumni in need of a cap-exempt H-1B visa pathway. Partner with us Offer your students access to a national network Our national network of Fellowship programs enables international students and alumni to pursue high-growth careers, continue working for their companies, or start their own businesses in the U.S. Partner with us 0 + Student participants 0 % Reported feeling prepared for their first job 0 % Believe the build fellowship should be offered at more schools How it works The Build Fellowship steps 1 Application Students apply to projects most suited to their background and career aspirations. They must meet the prerequisites to be considered for selection. Each project is 8-weeks long, operating on a rolling basis. 2 Participation Selected students participate in weekly live sessions with a Build Fellow. Each student works with a Build Fellow employed by one of our non-profit partners to produce a deliverable worth adding to their portfolio. 3 Completion After participating in all project modules and bringing their project to fruition, students will receive a certificate of completion. Main Content:
The Build Fellowship: Immigration Law Firms For law firms A cap-exempt H-1B pathway for your clients The Build Fellowship works with immigration attorneys from firms across the U.S. to offer an alternate path to the H-1B lottery. Nominate a client Partner with us Benefits Innovative solutions for you and your clients Offer clients reliable immigration solutions Offer clients a part-time cap-exempt H-1B Fellowship position if they are not selected in the lottery or are outside the U.S. and need a visa pathway File concurrent cap-exempt H-1B petitions for your clients once they are hired as a Fellow and approved for the part-time cap-exempt H-1B Refer clients for Fellowships year-round Nominate a client Partner with us Join our referral network Offer exclusive access to your clients through a custom webpage for your firm Join the network of attorneys we refer candidates to for concurrent cap-exempt H-1B petitions Explore attorneys Partner with us Grow your client base Offer additional immigration pathways for clients who participate in The Build Fellowship to stay in the U.S. Gain visibility through joint-marketing to showcase achievements of your clients in The Build Fellowship Nominate a client Partner with us 0 + Foreign national participants 0 Partner law firms 0 % Visa approval rate Testimonials A trusted immigration solution for talent and companies Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Lauren Abda Founder, Branchfood The Build Fellowship changed my life for the better! Not only did it do so in the most obvious way (set up an immigration pathway in the U.S.) but it also helped me discover my own leadership and management skills. ‍ Ketaki Adhikari Principal Research Associate, Foghorn Therapeutics The Build Fellowship has brought top talent from growing companies to inspire and educate our students. They have been instrumental in helping diverse learners build social capital and technical skills to land fulfilling roles at high-growth companies. ‍ Aisha Francis President, Franklin Tech The Build Fellowship has put together a superb program. We were able to get our employee from overseas and shepherd his H-1B capped process. Highly recommend as the complete end-to-end solution for your H-1B needs. ‍ Mason Zheng Founder, Telgorithm Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Jad Esber Founder, Koodos Labs The Build Fellowship has given us peace of mind. This opportunity allows us to retain our top talent and gives our employees a chance to practice their leadership and project management skills. Kendra Heard HR, Outrider.ai We're grateful to have learned about The Build Fellowship, which has been key to hiring and retaining talent in scientific expertise sets. Build is an invaluable resource in the face of an otherwise frustrating and opaque process. Robert DiFazio CEO, Parallel Bio Every year the H-1B cap lottery gets worse and the odds are stacked against employers and their candidates who require an H-1B work visa. I am very glad to have found out about Open Avenues [Build Fellowship] and its unique model to facilitate concurrent H-1B opportunities— it is definitely worth checking out. Bob Webber Webber Arredondo Oja, LLC The Open Avenues Foundation has proven to be an invaluable partner for my practice. The Build Fellowship has ensured that my clients are able to retain key foreign talent while participants can continue to develop their practical skills in the United States. This is an essential solution to problems posed by an unpredictable immigration landscape. Alex Peters Peters Immigration Law P.C. Our clients appreciate working with Open Avenues! The program provides an alternative path for individuals to live and work in the U.S. when their employment here is urgent and important and if they aren't qualified for an O-1 yet or can't afford to wait for the H-1B lottery. It's wonderful being able to offer our clients an alternate path. Not only are our clients' lives and companies changed, but it's amazing to pay it forward and improve the quality of U.S. STEM education for our students! Sophie Alcorn Alcorn Immigration Law Shritesh is a foreign national from Nepal, and came to the United States in 2015 to pursue his masters. He had a penchant for two things: entrepreneurship and mentorship—two pursuits he wanted to continue in the United States, a place he saw limitless in opportunities. After getting selected for The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues, Shritesh created an industry-based project through his company, Remix Labs where he was assigned a Queens College student named Wilber. An aspiring software engineer with a passion for coding and gaming, Wilber brought a fresh, technical perspective to the no-code software platform Remix Labs operates on. His dedication, above-and-beyond approach and work ethic did not go unnoticed. Shritesh was so impressed by his work, that Wilber became the first junior-level, no-interview hire. Mentoring Wilber and witnessing his growth reinforced the gratifying experience of guiding future tech talents.
“The internship at Remix Labs was great for someone like me who wanted to get into programming in the tech space. During the internship, I got exposure to the Remix Labs platform and all of its functionalities. The platform itself is a no-code tool used to build out applications. I also learned how to design the flow of an app process data in a programming environment. Shritesh was such a smart and approachable project leader, and helped me every step of the way. He was my biggest advocate and got me a job as a Product Engineer position at the company—with no interview! He believed in me that much! Though I’m not working on his team, I still consider him my mentor. He’s the reason I was able to start my career.”

Main Content:
The Build Fellowship: H-1B Solutions for Companies For companies Hire and retain top global talent Enable valued foreign national employees or prospective hires to work and grow in the U.S. through The Build Fellowship’s cap-exempt H-1B program. Get started Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Register for a webinar Looking for more? Benefits Companies progress with The Build Fellowship The Build Fellowship’s cap-exempt H-1B visa solution offers an immigration pathway to skilled global talent, with a 99% acceptance rate, without relying on the H-1B lottery. Attract and retain top talent The Build Fellowship allows U.S. companies to retain foreign national employees by offering Build Fellows ongoing immigration support and sponsoring them for part-time, cap-exempt H-1B visas. Find peace of mind Gain peace of mind knowing you have a back-up plan to the H-1B lottery, so you can forecast and plan your staff needs accordingly. Build talent pipelines Gain unique access to students entering the workforce who are trained with relevant industry knowledge. Nominate a candidate today Ready to nominate one of your employees as a candidate for The Build Fellowship? Get started $ 0 M Contributed to the U.S. GDP by Build Fellows 0 % Fellowship graduates listed on a patent $ 0 M+ Funding raised by Build Fellows Testimonials A trusted immigration solution for talent and companies Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Lauren Abda Founder, Branchfood The Build Fellowship changed my life for the better! Not only did it do so in the most obvious way (set up an immigration pathway in the U.S.) but it also helped me discover my own leadership and management skills. ‍ Ketaki Adhikari Principal Research Associate, Foghorn Therapeutics The Build Fellowship has brought top talent from growing companies to inspire and educate our students. They have been instrumental in helping diverse learners build social capital and technical skills to land fulfilling roles at high-growth companies. ‍ Aisha Francis President, Franklin Tech The Build Fellowship has put together a superb program. We were able to get our employee from overseas and shepherd his H-1B capped process. Highly recommend as the complete end-to-end solution for your H-1B needs. ‍ Mason Zheng Founder, Telgorithm Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Jad Esber Founder, Koodos Labs The Build Fellowship has given us peace of mind. This opportunity allows us to retain our top talent and gives our employees a chance to practice their leadership and project management skills. Kendra Heard HR, Outrider.ai We're grateful to have learned about The Build Fellowship, which has been key to hiring and retaining talent in scientific expertise sets. Build is an invaluable resource in the face of an otherwise frustrating and opaque process. Robert DiFazio CEO, Parallel Bio Every year the H-1B cap lottery gets worse and the odds are stacked against employers and their candidates who require an H-1B work visa. I am very glad to have found out about Open Avenues [Build Fellowship] and its unique model to facilitate concurrent H-1B opportunities— it is definitely worth checking out. Bob Webber Webber Arredondo Oja, LLC The Open Avenues Foundation has proven to be an invaluable partner for my practice. The Build Fellowship has ensured that my clients are able to retain key foreign talent while participants can continue to develop their practical skills in the United States. This is an essential solution to problems posed by an unpredictable immigration landscape. Alex Peters Peters Immigration Law P.C. Our clients appreciate working with Open Avenues! The program provides an alternative path for individuals to live and work in the U.S. when their employment here is urgent and important and if they aren't qualified for an O-1 yet or can't afford to wait for the H-1B lottery. It's wonderful being able to offer our clients an alternate path. Not only are our clients' lives and companies changed, but it's amazing to pay it forward and improve the quality of U.S. STEM education for our students! Sophie Alcorn Alcorn Immigration Law Shritesh is a foreign national from Nepal, and came to the United States in 2015 to pursue his masters. He had a penchant for two things: entrepreneurship and mentorship—two pursuits he wanted to continue in the United States, a place he saw limitless in opportunities. After getting selected for The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues, Shritesh created an industry-based project through his company, Remix Labs where he was assigned a Queens College student named Wilber. An aspiring software engineer with a passion for coding and gaming, Wilber brought a fresh, technical perspective to the no-code software platform Remix Labs operates on. His dedication, above-and-beyond approach and work ethic did not go unnoticed. Shritesh was so impressed by his work, that Wilber became the first junior-level, no-interview hire. Mentoring Wilber and witnessing his growth reinforced the gratifying experience of guiding future tech talents.
“The internship at Remix Labs was great for someone like me who wanted to get into programming in the tech space. During the internship, I got exposure to the Remix Labs platform and all of its functionalities. The platform itself is a no-code tool used to build out applications. I also learned how to design the flow of an app process data in a programming environment. Shritesh was such a smart and approachable project leader, and helped me every step of the way. He was my biggest advocate and got me a job as a Product Engineer position at the company—with no interview! He believed in me that much! Though I’m not working on his team, I still consider him my mentor. He’s the reason I was able to start my career.”

Main Content:
The Build Fellowship: H-1B Programs for Foreign Nationals A cap‑exempt H‑1B solution trusted by companies nationwide The Build Fellowship is a nationally recognized cap‑exempt H‑1B visa fellowship with a 99% approval rate. The program offers work visa pathways for global talent building careers and companies in the U.S. Get started Join our next info session Why Build? An immigration pathway to train the future U.S. workforce A reliable immigration solution The Build Fellowship offers a cap-exempt H-1B visa solution with a 99% acceptance rate, allowing foreign nationals to pursue careers in the U.S. Fills talent gaps for U.S. companies Attract the world’s top talent for full-time U.S. employment opportunities through partnering with The Build Fellowship. Advances missions of U.S. colleges The Build Fellowship partners with education institutions to build students’ industry skills through experiential learning projects. Get Started Learn More 0 + Foreign national participants 0 + Student participants 0 % Visa approval rate For global talent A cap-exempt H-1B program to help global talent build careers in the U.S. Find an H-1B visa solution If you are a foreign national who wants to work or continue working in the U.S., securing your visa is a top priority — The Build Fellowship is here to help. Get started Learn more Work with driven students from partners schools Build Fellows work part-time remotely leading students from partner colleges and universities in experiential, project-based learning while being sponsored for their cap-exempt H-1Bs. Get started Learn more Browse our immigration resources Explore resources, frequently asked questions, and webinars to ensure you understand all that The Build Fellowship has to offer. Get started For Companies Access specialized talent and maintain your competitive edge Attract the world’s top talent Attract the world’s top foreign nationals for full-time U.S. employment opportunities and retain existing talent by offering alternative visa solutions. Gain unique access to students entering the workforce who are trained with relevant industry knowledge. Get started Learn more A back-up plan to the H-1B lottery Achieve peace of mind knowing you have a back-up plan to the H-1B lottery, so you can forecast and plan your staff needs accordingly. Receive ongoing access to immigration support and guidance for your employees. Get started Learn more For students Dynamic and immersive 8-week projects led by Build Fellows Industry-focused learning Build Fellows lead students in real-world experiential learning projects and career development programming that will help them better understand their field of interest and bridge the gap between the classroom and industry. Get Started Learn more Resume building, entry-level projects Students produce deliverables they can showcase on their resumes and portfolios. Projects are designed to be accessible for students at any level of their professional career. Get Started Learn more Discover the Education Hub Join resume-building projects and gain hands-on experience with Build Fellows from the fast-growing industries. Get started Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Testimonials A trusted immigration solution for talent and companies Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Lauren Abda Founder, Branchfood The Build Fellowship changed my life for the better! Not only did it do so in the most obvious way (set up an immigration pathway in the U.S.) but it also helped me discover my own leadership and management skills. ‍ Ketaki Adhikari Principal Research Associate, Foghorn Therapeutics The Build Fellowship has brought top talent from growing companies to inspire and educate our students. They have been instrumental in helping diverse learners build social capital and technical skills to land fulfilling roles at high-growth companies. ‍ Aisha Francis President, Franklin Tech The Build Fellowship has put together a superb program. We were able to get our employee from overseas and shepherd his H-1B capped process. Highly recommend as the complete end-to-end solution for your H-1B needs. ‍ Mason Zheng Founder, Telgorithm Through The Build Fellowship we were able to retain exceptionally talented people that go above and beyond in their roles and are dedicated to the mission of our work. Jad Esber Founder, Koodos Labs The Build Fellowship has given us peace of mind. This opportunity allows us to retain our top talent and gives our employees a chance to practice their leadership and project management skills. Kendra Heard HR, Outrider.ai We're grateful to have learned about The Build Fellowship, which has been key to hiring and retaining talent in scientific expertise sets. Build is an invaluable resource in the face of an otherwise frustrating and opaque process. Robert DiFazio CEO, Parallel Bio Every year the H-1B cap lottery gets worse and the odds are stacked against employers and their candidates who require an H-1B work visa. I am very glad to have found out about Open Avenues [Build Fellowship] and its unique model to facilitate concurrent H-1B opportunities— it is definitely worth checking out. Bob Webber Webber Arredondo Oja, LLC The Open Avenues Foundation has proven to be an invaluable partner for my practice. The Build Fellowship has ensured that my clients are able to retain key foreign talent while participants can continue to develop their practical skills in the United States. This is an essential solution to problems posed by an unpredictable immigration landscape. Alex Peters Peters Immigration Law P.C. Our clients appreciate working with Open Avenues! The program provides an alternative path for individuals to live and work in the U.S. when their employment here is urgent and important and if they aren't qualified for an O-1 yet or can't afford to wait for the H-1B lottery. It's wonderful being able to offer our clients an alternate path. Not only are our clients' lives and companies changed, but it's amazing to pay it forward and improve the quality of U.S. STEM education for our students! Sophie Alcorn Alcorn Immigration Law Shritesh is a foreign national from Nepal, and came to the United States in 2015 to pursue his masters. He had a penchant for two things: entrepreneurship and mentorship—two pursuits he wanted to continue in the United States, a place he saw limitless in opportunities. After getting selected for The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues, Shritesh created an industry-based project through his company, Remix Labs where he was assigned a Queens College student named Wilber. An aspiring software engineer with a passion for coding and gaming, Wilber brought a fresh, technical perspective to the no-code software platform Remix Labs operates on. His dedication, above-and-beyond approach and work ethic did not go unnoticed. Shritesh was so impressed by his work, that Wilber became the first junior-level, no-interview hire. Mentoring Wilber and witnessing his growth reinforced the gratifying experience of guiding future tech talents.
“The internship at Remix Labs was great for someone like me who wanted to get into programming in the tech space. During the internship, I got exposure to the Remix Labs platform and all of its functionalities. The platform itself is a no-code tool used to build out applications. I also learned how to design the flow of an app process data in a programming environment. Shritesh was such a smart and approachable project leader, and helped me every step of the way. He was my biggest advocate and got me a job as a Product Engineer position at the company—with no interview! He believed in me that much! Though I’m not working on his team, I still consider him my mentor. He’s the reason I was able to start my career.”
Shritesh Bhattarai Open Avenues Fellow, Software Engineer at Remix Labs Previous slide Next slide Resources Immigration resources and fellowship information Events and webinars Keep up with The Build Fellowship's updates and activities. Page Title: Employee benefactor sample emails
H1: Employee benefactor sample emails
All Headings:
H1: Employee benefactor sample emails
H2: Employee benefactor sample email 1
H2: Employee benefactor sample email 2
Main Content: Employee benefactor sample emails All Guide and Brochures Employee benefactor sample emails Employee benefactor sample email 1 Dear EMPLOYER NAME, I hope this email finds you well. I am reaching out about a potential solution to my work visa situation. The Build Fellowship is an organization whose mission is to provide career pathways for everyone, no matter where they are from. They offer a cap-exempt H-1B visa solution for foreign nationals looking to work full-time in the U.S. I would work part-time for approximately 5 hours per week with a nonprofit through The Build Fellowship while also working full-time with COMPANY NAME. During my part-time work as a Build Fellow, I'd work directly with U.S. college and universities to advance the United States education system. The onboarding of new Fellows takes about 6-8 weeks, enabling cap subject companies, such as COMPANY NAME, to file a concurrent H-1B petition for my full-time employment. Companies are responsible for the financial commitment of the Fellowship program. I am attaching the Pricing information from Build. Although I am aware of the significant commitment that comes with this Fellowship, I believe it is the most sustainable solution to my work visa situation. It allows me to work 3 years with the ability to renew for an additional 3 years at COMPANY NAME. Additionally, the skills and experience I will gain from training students and networking with potential candidates for our company will benefit the future of COMPANY NAME as well. If you would like to learn more about The Build Fellowship visit their website here . You can also schedule an initial consultation with The Build Fellowship team here . Let me know if you have any questions. I appreciate your consideration. Best, YOUR NAME Employee benefactor sample email 2 Dear EMPLOYER NAME, I hope this email finds you well. I'm writing to share a promising solution to my work visa situation that offers an alternative to the H-1B lottery, with a 99%+ approval rate. This solution is a cap-exempt H-1B visa, sponsored by The Build Fellowship, that would allow me to continue working full-time at COMPANY NAME. The Build Fellowship is an organization whose mission is to provide career pathways for everyone, no matter where they are from. They offer a cap-exempt H-1B visa for foreign nationals seeking full-time employment in the U.S. like me. This solution allows me to work full time for COMPANY NAME, while working ~5 hours a week on a part-time basis with The Build Fellowship as a Global Talent Fellow. Highlights of The Build Fellowship: Talent Retention: Attract, hire, and retain the world's top talent to work in the U.S Certainty: 99% approval rate for eligible foreign nationals accepted into The Build Fellowship Speed: ~8-10 weeks total duration, from process start until concurrent H-1B is approved Timing: Employee can start working full-time immediately once concurrent H-1B is received by USCIS To join the Fellowship, you, as the employer, would need to nominate me for this opportunity. The Build Fellowship offers a free initial consultation to assess the probability of a successful approval before entering any contract. See this info session from the founder and CEO, Danielle Goldman, for a detailed overview, including benefits, next steps, and costs. Although I am aware of the significant commitment that comes with this Fellowship, it would allow me to continue to work at COMPANY NAME for 3 years with the ability to renew for an additional 3 years. The skills and experience I will gain from training students and networking with potential candidates will benefit the future of COMPANY NAME as well. You can learn more about The Build Fellowship at buildfellowship.com . You can also schedule an initial consultation with The Build Fellowship team here . Let me know if you have any questions. I appreciate your consideration. Best, YOUR NAME Download the brochure Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Page Title: The Build Fellowship pricing model
H1: The Build Fellowship pricing model
All Headings:
H1: The Build Fellowship pricing model
H2: Build & Company Employ the Fellow
H3: Company pays Build $4000 per month
H4: Fellow is employed by Build & the Company, both entities manage the immigration needs
Main Content: The Build Fellowship pricing model All Guide and Brochures The Build Fellowship pricing model Build & Company Employ the Fellow Company pays Build $4000 per month Fellow is employed by Build & the Company, both entities manage the immigration needs Build employs the foreign national in the Fellowshipfor 5 hours per week and sponsors them for a part-time, cap-exempt H-1B visa. Company employs the foreign national and sponsors them for a full-time, concurrent H-1B visa. H-4 dependent filings.‍ Request more information Looking for more? Page Title: Jasmine Kim – The Build Fellowship
Meta Description: Through this opportunity, I was able to picture myself as a data analyst. This was my first time using Tableau. Now, it has become one of the skills I can of...
All Headings: H3: Jasmine Kim
Main Content: Jasmine Kim – The Build Fellowship All Customer stories Jasmine Kim Queens College Cuny, Stony Brook University Through this opportunity, I was able to picture myself as a data analyst. This was my first time using Tableau. Now, it has become one of the skills I can offer to the companies I will be applying for. By doing this project, I have a solid presentation that I can add to my portfolio. I have a full-time job. I am not a traditional STEM student, and my background is in social sciences. I find that many internship opportunities are geared towards traditional, younger students. I am so grateful that Open Avenues [Build Fellowship] has given me a chance to build technical experience despite my unconventional career trajectory. The project leader was super nice. Despite his busy schedule, he made time to give me feedback on my project and even offered to do a resume review. He also taught us to how to use parameters and calculated fields inside Tableau, which came in very handy in my presentation. His feedback to add the article findings to my presentation made my claim stronger. Finding stories and pattern from data was very interesting and I even thought that I may be very good at it.

We utilized the time to answer questions and meet project goals. I'm thankful for this experience, it was a really good time exploring a career path I hadn't thought of before.

Meta Description: If you're an immigration attorney, foreign national or an employer looking to grow your business in the U.S. there is a chance you have dealt with the U.S. i...
H1: Bridge Builders: How Legal Experts & Entrepreneurs Are Shaping U.S. Immigration
All Headings:
H1: Bridge Builders: How Legal Experts & Entrepreneurs Are Shaping U.S. Immigration
H3: Event details
Main Content: Bridge Builders: How Legal Experts & Entrepreneurs Are Shaping U.S. Immigration – The Build Fellowship Online Bridge Builders: How Legal Experts & Entrepreneurs Are Shaping U.S. Immigration Zoom | May 28, 2024 Watch webinar Event details If you're an immigration attorney, foreign national or an employer looking to grow your business in the U.S. there is a chance you have dealt with the U.S. immigration system. Navigating immigration can be a long, windy road, but there are solutions that make your journey less stressful! Join Build Fellowship CEO Danielle Goldman as she moderates a compelling panel of immigration attorneys and a foreign national founder who have all dedicated their lives to building, growing, and succeeding in the U.S. Learn from expert immigration attorneys from Klug Law Firm comprised of Noah Klug (founder of Klug Law Firm), Jonathan Hammond (Senior Law Clerk at Klug Law Firm), and Cheryl Geirser (Senior Counsel at Klug Law Firm). They will be joined by Erkan Danis (CEO and owner of AMEC Consulting) to discuss work-visa solutions, innovative problem-solving, and persevering to achieve your dreams in the United States. You won't want to miss this one! Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Request more information Looking for more? Page Title: Cap-Exempt H-1B Solution for Top Talent
H1: Cap-Exempt H-1B Solution for Top Talent
All Headings:
H1: Cap-Exempt H-1B Solution for Top Talent
H2: The Build Fellowship is a cap-exempt H-1B program for top international talent.
H2: Qualifications & Sponsorship
H2: Talent Can Qualify, Apply, & Work within 8–12 Weeks
H3: Step 1
H3: Step 2
H3: Step 3
H3: Step 4
H2: Financial Commitment: $4000 per month
Main Content: Cap-Exempt H-1B Solution for Top Talent All Guide and Brochures Cap-Exempt H-1B Solution for Top Talent The Build Fellowship is a cap-exempt H-1B program for top international talent. Fellows are employed in part-time roles to prepare college and university students for careers. U.S. companies can then employ Fellows full-time on concurrent H-1Bs immediately, at any time of year. Qualifications & Sponsorship Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience Demonstrated expertise within a specialized field Ability to work remotely 5 hours per week Benefactor (an organization or legal entity) willing to support the costs of the Fellowship Talent Can Qualify, Apply, & Work within 8–12 Weeks Step 1 Foreign nationals are evaluated to ensure qualification for H-1B and eligibility for the Fellowship. Step 2 Fellows are hired for 5 hours per week and sponsored with cap-exempt H-1Bs to train students. Step 3 Fellows are eligible for full-time U.S. employers to file concurrent cap-exempt H-1B for them immediately. Step 4 Fellows stay in the program for a minimum of 12 months and up to 3 years, working for both the Fellowship and their full-time employer. Financial Commitment: $4000 per month Includes program fees and sponsorship for part-time cap-exempt H-1B visa Includes 5 hours per week of salary at the fair prevailing wage Download the brochure Request more information Looking for more? Page Title: Benefactor guide
H1: Benefactor guide
All Headings:
H1: Benefactor guide
H2: Funding The Fellowship
H2: Pricing Model
H3: $4000 per month
H2: FAQs
H3: Who is a benefactor?
H3: How do benefactors fund the Fellowship?
H3: What do benefactors agree to?
H2: How do I talk to a benefactor about funding my Fellowship?
Main Content: Benefactor guide All Guide and Brochures Benefactor guide The Build Fellowship offers a cap-exempt H-1B visasolution with a 99% acceptance rate, allowing foreign national talent to pursue careers in the fastest-growing industries across the United States. If you are a foreign national who wants to work or continue working in the U.S., securing your visa is a top priority — The Build Fellowship is here to help. Funding The Fellowship You will need a benefactor to finance your Fellowship, as a Fellow cannot pay for their own Fellowship. There are two primary types of benefactors: U.S. Employers and companies willing to sponsor a candidate's Fellowship Individuals willing to fund a candidate's Fellowship through a legal entity (like an LLC they form) Pricing Model $4000 per month Includes program fees and sponsorship for part-time cap-exempt H-1B visa Includes 5 hours per week of salary at the fair prevailing wage FAQs Who is a benefactor? An organization that has an interest supporting a Fellow’s career development in the U.S. Can be any type of organization - nonprofit, LLC, corporation, etc. - inside or outside of the U.S. Benefactor organizations can have a relationship with the Fellow (employee, desired employee, owned by a relative, friend, or even be owned by the Fellow themselves) Benefactors do not need to commit to employing the Fellow, but they must commit to paying the Fellowship fees How do benefactors fund the Fellowship? Benefactor commits to paying the monthly program fee Benefactor payments cannot be from a personal bank account, must be from the business account Proof of funds must be sent to The Build Fellowship (bank statement, etc) demonstrating access to $250,000 funds or provide payment up front for 6 months of fees What do benefactors agree to? Benefactors must sign the Benefactor Agreement with The Build Fellowship The Fellowship and cap-exempt H-1B will only last as long as there is an active Benefactor agreement The Fellow can change Benefactors as long as a new organization signs a Benefactor Agreement The Fellow can have a concurrent employer who is not the benefactor as long as the benefactor agreement remains in place and the benefactor signs off on the concurrent employer How do I talk to a benefactor about funding my Fellowship? Securing a U.S. work visa is difficult, even for highly skilled foreign nationals who qualify for the H-1B visa are rarely accepted due to a randomized lottery. Last year – only 24% of applicants were selected. The Build Fellowship is a program that will allow you to live and work in the U.S. by securing a cap-exempt H-1B visa. Fellows work 5 hours a week for The Build Fellowship’s nonprofit partners training students and advancing the U.S. education system. Once a foreign national's Build Fellowship starts, they are then eligible to work full time for a U.S. company. This makes hiring the foreign national more appealing. The Fellowship lasts a minimum of twelve months and up to three years. An additional three year extension is possible. Download the brochure Request more information Looking for more? Page Title: Information for International Students Entering the Job Market
H1: Information for International Students Entering the Job Market
All Headings:

Main Content: Information for International Students Entering the Job Market All Guide and Brochures Information for International Students Entering the Job Market Understanding Your Visa Options: H-1B vs. OPT/F-1/CPT OPT (Optional Practical Training): Secure a visa with a 99% acceptance rate, eliminating uncertainty. Avoid the annual H-1B lottery system, providing a dependable visa solution. Lasts up to three years, with the possibility of an additional three year extension. Career Advancement: Gain valuable work experience in your field while participating in mentorship programs. Develop leadership and project management skills, enhancing your professional profile. Employer Confidence: Companies are more inclined to hire candidates with guaranteed visa status. Reduces employer concerns about visa-related employment interruptions. Significantly less expensive than pursuing a Masters or PHD in the U.S. Candidate Qualifications A Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience in a specialized field. Ability to dedicate 5+ hours per week to educational programming initiatives and workforce development. A benefactor (a company, organization, or individual) willing to support the Fellowship costs – Fellows cannot fund their own Fellowship. Fellowship Commitment Applications are accepted on a rolling basis throughout the year, Fellowships can begin at any time. Fellows are sponsored for cap-exempt H-1Bs for up to 3 years, with a minimum 12 month commitment. A 3 year extension is possible. Evaluating Your OPT Timeline STEM Graduates: Maximize your 3-year STEM OPT to build experience and strengthen your H-1B application. Plan your transition from OPT to H-1B through The Build Fellowship to ensure continuous employment. Non-STEM Graduates: Utilize your 1-year OPT effectively by seeking relevant work experience. Explore The Build Fellowship to secure your visa and continue your career uninterrupted. Employer Considerations Job Security: Employers may be hesitant to invest in candidates with uncertain visa statuses. Companies are searching for a backup option if their employees were not selected in the annual lottery. The Build Fellowship's cap-exempt H-1B program provides job security, making you a more attractive hire. Long-Term Employment: Assured visa sponsorship through The Build Fellowship enables you to commit to long-term employment, benefiting both you and your employer. Enhancing Your Marketability Visa Assurance: Present yourself as a candidate who does not require immediate visa sponsorship by securing an H-1B visa through The Build Fellowship. Applications for The Build Fellowship are accepted year-round Increase your appeal to potential employers who prefer hiring candidates with secured visa status. Skill Development: Participate in The Build Fellowship to develop leadership and project management skills. Gain practical experience and mentorship opportunities, enhancing your professional development. Build your portfolio through Build projects. Networking Opportunities: Engage with a cohort of skilled peers through The Build Fellowship. Expand your professional network, opening doors to new career opportunities. For more information on how The Build Fellowship can support your career in the U.S., visit The Build Fellowship. Download the brochure Request more information Looking for more? Page Title: International Student Offices: Immigration Solutions for Build Fellows
H1: International Student Offices: Immigration Solutions for Build Fellows
All Headings:
H1: International Student Offices: Immigration Solutions for Build Fellows
H2: The Build Fellowship provides higher education institutions in the U.S. with access to the brightest minds from across the globe.
Main Content: International Student Offices: Immigration Solutions for Build Fellows All Guide and Brochures International Student Offices: Immigration Solutions for Build Fellows The Build Fellowship provides higher education institutions in the U.S. with access to the brightest minds from across the globe. International student departments work with The Build Fellowship to educate students about this option post-graduation. For international students finishing Optional Practical Training (OPT) post-graduation, the H-1B work visa is the most common next step to work in the U.S. The annual H-1B lottery selects 85,000 registrants at random, often restricting promising founders and highly-skilled talent. Congress deemed four types of organizations exempt, or cap-exempt, from the annual H-1B lottery system: Nonprofit research institutions Government research institutions Universities Nonprofit organizations affiliated with universities Build Fellows are offered part-time employment at nonprofit organizations affiliated with universities and are in-turn sponsored for cap-exempt H-1B visas. While in part-time employment with a cap-exempt nonprofit, any U.S. employer can then file a concurrent cap-exempt H-1B for a Build Fellow, enabling them to stay and work in the United States. Main Content: Become a university partner All Guide and Brochures Become a university partner The Build Fellowship is a national network of Fellowship programs offered to foreign national innovators, experts, and entrepreneurs committed to shaping the future of the United States. Global talent from high-growth industries are employed part-time as Build Fellows to lead students at our partner colleges and universities in real-world experiential learning projects and career development programming. Fellows are sponsored for part-time cap-exempt H-1B visas, enabling them to stay and build companies and careers in the U.S. while ensuring students are prepared to enter their careers. Provide your students with mentorship and expertise from top global talent in the fastest-growing industries. Fellowship overview Build Fellows work approximately 5 hours per week, providing 1:1 lecture and mentorship sessions and creating compelling experiential learning projects for students at The Build Fellowship’s educational institution partners. Education institution benefits Open opportunities for students to get practical training and connect with employers in high-growth fields. Create immigration pathways for international student alumni to build careers in the U.S. Serve as a catalyst for innovation driven by foreign talent in the regional economy. 1000+ student participants 93% of students report they are more likely to pursue a career in STEM or Business 94% of students report they are confident they will be successful in the STEM / Business industry Offer your students access to cutting-edge companies in the U.S. Join our network of prominent schools enhancing their student experience. Main Content: Become a Build Fellowship partner school All Guide and Brochures Become a Build Fellowship partner school Become a Partner School The Build Fellowship is a national network of Fellowship programs offered to foreign national innovators, experts, and entrepreneurs committed to shaping the future of the United States. Global talent from high-growth industries are employed part-time as Build Fellows to lead students at our partner colleges and universities in real-world experiential learning projects and career development programming. Fellows are sponsored for part-time cap-exempt H-1B visas, enabling them to stay and build companies and careers in the U.S. while ensuring students are prepared to enter their careers. The Build Fellowship incurs no cost upon partner schools or their students. The Build Fellowship Partners with Education Institutions Career Development Opportunities for All Students The Build Fellowship partners with education institutions to build student’s industry-skills through experiential learning projects, provide them with mentorship from global talent, and open opportunities for students to get practical training and connect with employers in the U.S. 's fastest growing industries. 1000+ students participating 94% of students report they are confident they will be successful in the STEM / Business industry 175+ foreign nationals participating Career Services: Education Programs to Train Students Dynamic and immersive 8-week projects led by Build Fellows that aim to introduce selected students to their fields of interest. Selected participants engage in weekly live sessions with a Build Fellow and approximately 2–15 students. Students receive a certificate upon completion. Industry Focused Experience The projects center around specific industries, providing participants with hands-on, real-world challenges that will help them better understand their field of interest and bridge the gap between the classroom and industry. Resume Building Students produce deliverables they can showcase on their resumes and portfolios to impress hiring managers filing entry-level positions. Entry-level Projects are designed to be accessible for students at any level of their professional career. We encourage first and second year students to participate. What are Build Sessions? Build Sessions are led by Build Fellows and involve tailored 1:1 interactions, focusing on various aspects of career development. Sessions provide students with the opportunity to grow their network, build their social capital, and receive mentorship from global talent. There are four types of Build Sessions Industry and career conversations Technical interview simulations General HR interview simulations Resume feedback and review International Student Offices: Support Your International Students & Alumni For international students finishing Optional Practical Training (OPT) post-graduation, the H-1B work visa is the most common next step to work in the United States. Universities require help attaining solutions for their international students and alumni to find alternatives to the capped H-1B lottery. Build Fellows are offered part-time employment opportunities at non-profit organizations affiliated with universities and sponsored for cap-exempt H-1B visas. Who are Build Fellows? Entrepreneurs, innovators, international alumni of our partner schools are offered part-time employment opportunities through The Build Fellowship. Fellows are sponsored for cap-exempt H-1B visas, which enables U.S. employers to file a concurrent cap-exempt H-1B for them to stay and work in the U.S. Requirements to become a Build Fellow: Completed Bachelors' Degree Have an employer or job offer Interest in working with students My time with The Build Fellowship as a Software Developer Specialist was an immensely rewarding experience. Leading projects and overseeing students allowed me to witness the growth of aspiring developers first hand.The Build Fellowship’s commitment to diversity and inclusion created a vibrant community for fresh perspectives to thrive.Beyond technical skills, the program emphasized leadership and collaboration, enriching both my career and personal growth. I'm grateful for the chance to contribute to a cause that empowers young talents and drives positive change in the tech industry. Rishabh Gupta Software Development Fellow The Build Fellowship Join Our Network of College & University Partners Contact Us Danielle Goldman Chief Executive Officer danielle@buildfellowship.com Danila Blanco Travnicek Director of Education danila@buildfellowship.com Download the brochure Request more information Looking for more? Page Title: The Build Fellowship Overview
H1: The Build Fellowship Overview
All Headings:
H1: The Build Fellowship Overview
H2: An innovative cap-exempt H-1B solution
H2: The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues is a nationwide, cap-exempt H-1B visa program offered to foreign national experts and innovators seeking to grow companies and careers in the U.S.
H3: Key benefits for law firms & attorneys
H3: Step 1: Nominate
H3: Step 2: Processing
H3: Step 3: Approval
H2: Build Fellows are employed part-time by The Build Fellowship non-profit partners and are able to work full-time for U.S. companies who provide concurrent sponsorship.
H3: Candidate qualifications
H3: Sponsoring a Fellow
H3: Fellow responsibilities
H3: Program length
Main Content: The Build Fellowship Overview All Guide and Brochures The Build Fellowship Overview An innovative cap-exempt H-1B solution U.S. immigration law firms face complex challenges to provide comprehensive solutions for their clients, particularly those who might not easily fit into standard categories for visas or employment-based sponsorship. The Build Fellowship can serve as a valuable partner, offering a cap-exempt H-1B visa solution with a 99% acceptance rate for highly skilled individuals to work and contribute in the United States. The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues is a nationwide, cap-exempt H-1B visa program offered to foreign national experts and innovators seeking to grow companies and careers in the U.S. Key benefits for law firms & attorneys Offer clients a part-time cap-exempt H-1B Fellowship position if they are not selected in the lottery or are outside the U.S. and need a visa pathway. File concurrent cap-exempt H-1B petitions for your clients once hired as a Fellow and approved for the part-time cap-exempt H-1B. Refer clients for Fellowships year round. Offer exclusive access to your clients through a custom webpage for your firm. Join the network of attorneys we refer candidates to for concurrent cap-exempt H-1B petitions. Offer additional immigration pathways for clients who participate in the Fellowship to stay in the U.S. Step 1: Nominate The Build Fellowship welcomes and assesses applications from foreign national innovators, entrepreneurs, and experts seeking an immigration solution for the United States. Step 2: Processing The Build Fellowship works with stakeholders to place top candidates in part-time Fellowship positions and sponsor them for cap-exempt H-1B visas. Step 3: Approval Build Fellows work part-time at non-profit partner organizations, allowing them to work for U.S. companies full-time on a cap-exempt H-1B visas. Build Fellows are employed part-time by The Build Fellowship non-profit partners and are able to work full-time for U.S. companies who provide concurrent sponsorship. Candidate qualifications A Bachelor's degree or demonstrated expertise in a specialized field. Exhibit a commitment to dedicate 5+ hours weekly to support education initiatives and workforce development. Candidates must have a benefactor willing to support the Fellowship costs– Fellows cannot fund their own Fellowship. Sponsoring a Fellow Candidates are nominated by full-time employers or a fiscal sponsor. Sponsors partner with The Build Fellowship to offer the opportunity to the foreign national. Fellow responsibilities Work 5+ hours per week remotely with Build’s education and research partners on 1:1 lecture and mentorship sessions and experiential learning projects in the Fellow’s specialized field. Hours are flexible based on Fellow schedule. Program length Fellows are accepted on a rolling basis and can start the program at any time of the year. Fellowships last a minimum of twelve months and up to three years – an additional three year extension is possible. Download the brochure Request more information Looking for more? Main Content: Become a Build Fellowship immigration law partner All Guide and Brochures Become a Build Fellowship immigration law partner An Innovative Cap-Exempt H-1B Solution U.S. immigration law firms face complex challenges to provide comprehensive solutions for their clients, particularly those who might not easily fit into standard categories for visas or employment-based sponsorship. The Build Fellowship can serve as a valuable partner, offering a cap-exempt H-1B visa solution with a 99% acceptance rate for highly skilled individuals to work and contribute in the United States. The Build Fellowship by Open Avenues is a nationwide, cap-exempt H-1B visa program offered to foreign national experts and innovators seeking to grow companies and careers in the U.S. Key Benefits for Law Firms & Attorneys Offer clients a part-time cap-exempt H-1B Fellowship position if they are not selected in the lottery or are outside the U.S. and need a visa pathway. File concurrent cap-exempt H-1B petitions for your clients once hired as a Fellow and approved for the part-time cap-exempt H-1B. Refer clients for Fellowships year round. Offer exclusive access to your clients through a custom webpage for your firm. Join the network of attorneys we refer candidates to for concurrent cap-exempt H-1B petitions. Step 1: Nominate Your Client Nominate your clients who qualify for the H-1B and are seeking to live and work in the U.S. The Build Fellowship will assess applications and evaluate your client’s eligibility to ensure compliance. Step 2: Processing The Build Fellowship works with stakeholders to place top candidates in part-time Fellowship positions and sponsor them for cap-exempt H-1B visas. Step 3: Approval Build Fellows work part-time at nonprofit partner organizations, allowing them to work for U.S. companies fulltime on a cap-exempt H-1B visas. Build Fellows are employed part-time by The Build Fellowship non-profit partners and are able to work full-time for U.S. companies who provide concurrent sponsorship. Candidate Qualifications A Bachelor's degree or demonstrated expertise in a specialized field. Exhibit a commitment to dedicate 5+ hours weekly to support education initiatives and workforce development. Candidates must have a benefactor willing to support the Fellowship costs – Fellows cannot fund their own Fellowship. Sponsoring a Fellow Candidates are nominated by full-time employers or a fiscal sponsor. Sponsors partner with The Build Fellowship to offer the opportunity to the foreign national. Fellow Responsibilities Work 5+ hours per week remotely with Build’s education and research partners on 1:1 lecture and mentorship sessions and experiential learning projects in the Fellow’s specialized field. Hours are flexible based on Fellow schedule. Program Length Fellows are accepted on a rolling basis and can start the program at any time of the year. Fellowships last a minimum of twelve months and up to three years – an additional three year extension is possible. The Build Fellowship Pricing Model.‍ Build & Company Employ the Fellow‍ Company pays Build $4000 per month‍ Fellow is employed by Build & the Company, both entities manage the immigration needs Build employs the foreign national in the Fellowship for 5 hours per week and sponsors them for a part-time, cap-exempt H-1B visa. Company employs the foreign national and sponsors them for a full-time, concurrent H-1B visa. H-4 dependent filings. Timeline Evaluation & Contracting 2–3 week Nomination & Consultation Screening & H-1B Evaluation Contract Signed Visa Processing 6-8 Week Petition Development Visa Approved (if no RFE) Employment Starts 1 Week Fellowship Begins Full-Time Employer Files Petition Download the brochure Request more information Looking for more?
